thread.title: Computer glitch grounds all United flights
thread.title_full: Computer glitch grounds all United flights

author: Paul J. Gough
title: Computer glitch grounds all United flights
text:
See All Homes of the Day There are 15 scheduled departures and 16 arrivals set for United Airlines at Pittsburgh International Airport through the rest of the day. It wasn’t clear how long it would take for the airline to return to service. One UnitedContinental flight, Republic Flight 3880, returned to Pittsburgh International Airport about 20 minutes after takeoff shortly before 7 a.m. Wednesday. The flight, a Dash-8 Q400 turboprop, was bound for Newark, according to FlightAware.com. A spokeswoman didn’t have immediate information on whether the return was related to the computer problems. 
Want Pittsburgh Logistics & Transportation news in your inbox? Sign up for our free email newsletters. @united we are being told the entire United systems are down here at EWR. Every plane is on hold. Is that true
